column4: How to get an info about modules loaded on bootup and then after modprobe command?
missed a lot.. are you trying to get your wacom working? if so which one.?
Yeah. I have only three devices in gimp or wacomcpl : pad, eraser and cursor ,but no stylus.
I'll pastbin my xorg for you.. mine works.. graphire 4
http://pastebin.com/f47307863
have you loaded wacom-tools? also you should compare my xorg with yours to see the diff.
also .. hardy should have built in support for wacom without having to modprobe anything.
It's the same. I see that You still have these 'forcedevice' parts. You mean, that I need to reinstall wacom-tools? Oh, BTW: I'm using 7.10 (2.6.22-14-generic)
I have them but I've commented them out.  I did have them in for Feisty and commented out the lines with "usb" and it worked.. might try that
Ok. I will. Tnx.
np
Are You there?
yep
So, it doesn't work. I'll send you pastebin. Wait.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/9878/
send me xorg..
also looks like maybe compiz is interfearing with wacom on your system.. it registers then unregisters..
with a seg fault on compiz
incoming...http://paste.ubuntu.com/9879/
I've commented out these 'usb'-related lines, but still no effect
looking at xorg now.. hang on.
add the line ( Option ForceDevice "ISDV4" )# Tablet PC Only to all the "InputDevice" lines dealing with wacom..
Ok. I'll try that.
And nothing again. I've edited xorg, just as You've told me, but still no movement and still no 'stylus' device
